intro: Kedrostis minutiflora, commonly known as the small-flowered African cucumber, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers, squashes, and gourds. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are typically unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. Its fruits are small, round, and green, often used in traditional medicine. The plant thrives in warm, sunny environments and is adapted to arid conditions.
